item.title: Report E-2024050312
item.description:
Report E-2024050312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-06
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: HAWAIIAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Event Details: • HA57 SAN-OGG 6APR24 @ approximately 830 am • During boarding, passenger approached Flight Attendant with a Amazon Kindle that was smoking • Flight attendant placed kindle in fire containment bag (AVSAC) and placed bag in the jetbridge • Item was contained in AVSAC and TSA, and SAN Harbor police were contacted. Once scene was clear flight was released. • SAN Harbor police retained the damaged/burnt kindle.

item.title: Report E-2024050270
item.description:
Report E-2024050270

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5 ounces of Wet Look Green were released from one 5-gallon metal pail due to the lid appearing to have been popped open prior to arrival. The spilled amount only impacted the container, no surfaces were affected. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they felt comfortable cleaning the spill with the available personal protective equipment and placed the contents into a 30-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050269
item.description:
Report E-2024050269

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 pints of Landau Top & Trim Adhesive were released from one 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by the terminal. The release impacted trailer #3213720. The release was completely dried upon arrival. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 6 ounces of Mark-It Printing Ink were released from (1) 5-gallon metal drum due to improper loading. The release impacted the cardboard only. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with the personal protective equipment available on site.

item.title: Report E-2024050256
item.description:
Report E-2024050256

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: IRWINDALE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was punctured in transit and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. PES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the ink-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024050248
item.description:
Report E-2024050248

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 2, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1791 was damaged due to a manufacturing defect and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock, packaging, and adjacent items. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. PES deployed neutralizing agent and worked it in with rag. All impacted waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024050569
item.description:
Report X-2024050569

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER AT RED BELT PICK OFF USING THE DECISION TREE, THE PACKAGE WAS ON THE FLOOR WITH MINOR CLEAN UP , THE PACKAGE WAS UPRIGHT, THE PACKAGE WAS SORTED TO RED BELT BY EMPLOYEE IN THE SORT AISLE, BROUGHT BACK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE AND RESPONDER OPENED IT UP , THERE WERE 4 -4 LITER GLASS BOTTLES OF SUPELCO OMNISOLV ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL, ONE OF THE BOTTLE CRACKED , RESPONDER PROCESED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP

item.title: Report E-2024050210
item.description:
Report E-2024050210

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-19
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A third party hauler was hooking onto a Veolia's outbound trailer. When the trailer made contact with the king pin, a yellow liquid began to drop slowly out of the trailer, just behind the tractor. The driver was instructed to pull away from the van. A Veolia employee then went to grab a bag of solid absorb and placed it below the leak. Approximately 4oz of the liquid was spilled onto the cement floor before it stopped. The trailer was then unloaded. During this time, the employees noticed that 3 drums were leaking from their bottom and sides. The bottom of the drums were corroded which caused pinholes on the bottom portion of the body of the drums. Employees then overpacked the 3 drums into poly containers. Approximately 4 oz of the liquid was released onto the trailer's floor. These 3 drums were profiled as a solid by the vendor. Possible misclassification of the waste along with improper packaging may have caused the leak. All three drums were placed into a poly 85 salvage drum. The manifest was then rejected back to the broker, and the broker came back to pick up their drums.
